text: The Neda () is a river in the western Peloponnese in Greece. It is long, and its drainage area is .Preliminary Flood Risk Assessment , Ministry of Environment, Energy and Climate Change, p. 38 It is unique in the sense that it is the only river in Greece with a feminine name. ==Geography== The river begins on the southern slope of Mount Lykaion, near the village of Neda in northern Messenia. It flows to the west through a varied landscape of barren rock and forests. From near Figaleia until its mouth it forms the border of Messenia and Elis. There is a well known waterfall near the village Platania. The Neda flows into the Gulf of Kyparissia, a bay of the Ionian Sea, near the village Giannitsochori. ==Places along the river== The Neda flows along the villages Neda, Kakaletri, Figaleia, Platania, Karyes and Giannitsochori. ==See also== *List of rivers in Greece ==References== Category:Landforms of Elis Category:Landforms of Messenia Category:Rivers of Greece Category:Rivers of Peloponnese (region) Category:Rivers of Western Greece Category:Drainage basins of the Ionian Sea
title: Neda (river)
